intro: Aetheolaena hypoleuca, commonly known as the white-flowered lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking white petals and robust, strap-like leaves. The plant typically grows in woodland areas and is adapted to well-drained soils. It produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
